Darwin, and others, explained how life changed from what it used to be to what it is now; they had no concern for where it came from in the first place, they simply knew that it came from somewhere. How did they know it came from somewhere? Because there's life here now! The answer to the question of where it all started didn't get seriously studied until well after Darwin. So no, the one does not pick up from the other, and the study of evolution does not in any way depend on abiogenesis. Evolution doesn't care where life came from, only what happens to it once it's around.
